summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Square, Inc. (now Block, Inc.) on August 17, 2019, demanding financial records related to a specific phone number's Square or Cash App account. The subpoena seeks subscriber information, payment records, and transaction details as part of an investigation into alleged violations of federal conspiracy, false statements, and obstruction statutes.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: He is the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed and issued the grand jury subpoena to Square, Inc.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date for Square, Inc.
events.description: The subpoena commands Square, Inc. to appear before a grand jury in New York to testify and produce records, though a personal appearance is waived if records are produced by this date.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued to Square, Inc.
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a subpoena to Square, Inc. for financial records related to an account associated with a specific phone number, as part of an investigation into alleged federal violations.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Square, Inc., 1455 Market Street, Suite 600, San Francisco, CA 94103
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of a federal grand jury investigation into alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy), 1001 (false statements), and 1519 (obstruction).
It targets all financial records from Square or Cash App accounts registered to a specific, unstated phone number, seeking comprehensive subscriber and transaction data.
The document reveals the U.S. Attorney's Office under Geoffrey Berman was using financial subpoenas to investigate matters related to the Epstein case in August 2019.
The subpoena allows Square, Inc. to avoid a personal appearance by producing the requested records with a custodian declaration by August 30, 2019.
The requested data is extremely broad, including IP addresses, payment methods, bank details, and all customer service communications related to the account.
